name: Sebastian's on the Beach

reviews.title: We'll Be Back!
reviews.text: My husband and I first traveled here about 12 years ago. We went sailing twice and always made sure to stop by Sebastians for dinner and purchase their rum!We returned with friends 2 years ago, and they loved it , too.When we initially looked for a vacation spot, we did not want a 15 story hotel with 5 restaurants and 10 pools. We're glad we found this jewel on Apple Bay. It is low key and peaceful. Everyone was friendly, we loved our 2nd floor beach front room. We left the glass door open at night so we could listen to the surf as we went to sleep and woke up! We enjoyed our meals and spirits. If you want a little nightlife, head over to Quito's and dance to raggae music! Head to the Top of the World resaurant for a bite to eat and take in the breath taking view. We never went to the Surar Mill. We liked trying other small restaurants in the little side streets. Taxis were easily available and we also rented a jeep for a few days so we could explore the island and its beaches. Check out Smuggler's Cove. If you have never snorkled try it, you'll be hooked. You can make a day trip if you choose. Head to Jost Van Dyke and visit Foxy's. We hope to be back with more friends next year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After realizing I wasn't in a big city five star hotel, it was nice not having the TV, and the roster started to grow on us.
reviews.title: a busy week, a mixed review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All jokes aside, the staff was really nice, the location was good, everything was afordable by cab. The hotel had a little market inside, so everynight I would just walk 10 feet from the bar to the market and buy some beers for $1.50 vs $4 at the bar, just back and forth all night and it was quick, I gave the waitress a $10 tip and we were all happy. All in all, you get what you pay for, but I am used to staying at much nicer hotels, but I wish I was at Sebastian's on the Beach right now.
reviews.title: Romantic Views

likes.liked: — The sound of waves crashing so close

reviews.text: We stayed at Sebastians for a week in January, 2006, room #12. Incidentally, we came on the ferry from St. Thomas which was a fun alternative to flying to Beef I. We had visited BVI three times before as sailors and wanted to try a more relaxed vacation.
reviews.title: Food is horrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atmosphere at Sebastians was somewhat unfriendly at first but became warmer as the week progressed and pleasantries were exchanged with the staff. Our room, #12, overlooked the main courtyard of the hotel. This was pleasant as we got to see all the comings and going. However, on the night of the live music it proved to be a problem as it prevented us from getting to sleep. The room was on the second floor which is really a necessity to insure any privacy from folks walking by.
reviews.title: Sebastian's is Sensational!!!

reviews.text: What a great place!!! We stayed in the Seaside Villas, which was clean, roomy and great for a family of 4. The restuarant was great and the service was perfect. The beach was beautiful. This hotel is the gem of the BVI's.
reviews.title: Amazing and Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 8 days at Sebastians and loved it. We were in a Seaside Villa. Had a great ocean view and only 2 minute walk to the beach. Very quiet, no problem getting a lounge chair, beach was clean with nice sand and plenty of room for the few people there. Felt very safe. I was a little worried after reading some of the other reviews regarding the locals hanging out by the phone box, but that was not a problem and they were no problem at all. Nice restaurant, food was good. Staff were very friendy and helpful, never had any problem with that. It was a quick 10 minute drive to Cane Garden, where we ate nearly every night. Cane Garden is packed during the day with day trippers from the cruise ships, so we were glad to be at Sebastians to have some peace and quiet and a nearly empty beach. Seaside Villa rooms are roomy with comfortable beds and nice size bathrooms. We kept the patio doors open every night and slept to the sound of the waves. Loved Tortola and loved Sebastians.
reviews.title: Loved Sebastians
Time well spent!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: After some fairly thorough internet research my Wife and I thought that the west end of Tortola and Sebastian's would be the best bet for 10 days of paradise. We just got back and our stay was all and more that we hoped for. Room 9 is second floor with balcony, Ocean view/on beach and the sounds of surf..Perfect! The food is above average yet we had a jeep to tour the entire island and eat elsewhere. Don't miss BananaKeet Restaurant the food, views, music and staff make for a great time. A day sail on the catamaran Mystique out of Soper's Hole was an absolute blast. White bay on Jost [island in front of Sebastian's] is another "Must Visit". Diving the wreck of the "Rhone" with Blue water Divers [Emma and Tim] was crystal clear enjoyment. There's a lobster down there the size of a guitar!

reviews.title: Eh
reviews.text: I could go on and on...yet...the stay at Sebastian's and Tortola was a 10. The room was clean, no bugs, well maintained, pleasant [yet low key] staff, quiet and a location on the west end making for an excellent base to enjoy the island.

I recently returned from a stay at Sebastians. I stayed in the beachfront rooms for 2 nights, before moving to the tropical yard rooms. The beachfront rooms were great, and I definately recommend those. However, the tropical yard rooms are another story. Unless you like loads of mosquitos, rooms the size of a closet, and a rooster for an alarm clock between 2-5am, I don't suggest staying in those rooms.
reviews.title: Good for the price...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Sebastians while visiting Tortola. We were also disappointed with the rude staff. It seems that no matter how nice and accomodating we were there was never a reciprocal effect. We stayed in room 7, upstairs, beachfront. We were kept awake until well past midnight with music coming from the Bomba Shack down the street, and also by the gang of people hanging out on the corner. There was a whole bunch of young adults just hanging out by the phones, using and selling drugs. I saw this happen every night!!! I was surprised that management did nothing about this. I live in the inner city and I personally feel safer at home than I did while staying at Sebastians. Unfortunately we could not leave the door of the balcony open to hear the ocean, because we were afraid of unwelcome visitors. The only really nice part of Sebastians was the awesome view from our room and the sunsets. The food was average, room was LESS than average. We will not be back.
reviews.title: Less than average stay at Sebastians

reviews.text: We have just come back from a three weeks stay at Sebastian's. We loved it all the way.
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: Low season, of course, but the facilities were perfect. However the food has potential for improvment. The room was very nice and perfectly cleaned every day. Very friendly staff, but give them a little time to get to know you, before you expect a smile.
reviews.title: I'm not sure I would stay again.....

reviews.text: We chose a backyard room, because of the price for such a long stay. For our next stay (scheduled to occur within four years), we will consider a seaview room.
reviews.title: villa were great

reviews.text: The beach has a rocky bottom, but we used it often enough. We would however, recommend other beautiful beaches. There are plenty to choose from. Check with the excellent painter, David Thrasher, that has his studio 50 yds. away. He has lived there for lots of years and has an objetive opinion.
reviews.title: Sebastians - Ultimate in Laid-Back Comfort
